com.nutiteq.ui
Class MapListener

java.lang.Object
  com.nutiteq.ui.MapListener

public abstract class MapListener
extends java.lang.Object

Listener for map events (element clicking, map movement, etc). Also provides hooks for custom OpenGL rendering.

Constructor Summary

Constructor Detail

MapListener

public MapListener()
Method Detail

onMapMoved

public abstract void onMapMoved()
Gets called when the map is moved. The method is called from the main thread.

onMapClicked

public abstract void onMapClicked(double x,
                                  double y,
                                  boolean longClick)
Gets called when a click is performed on a empty map area. Coordinates are in the base map's projection's coordinate system. The method is called from the main thread.

Parameters:
x - x component of the click coordinate
y - y component of the click coordinate
longClick - true if a long click was performed, false if a normal click was performed

onVectorElementClicked

public abstract void onVectorElementClicked(VectorElement vectorElement,
                                            double x,
                                            double y,
                                            boolean longClick)
Gets called when a click is performed on a vector element. Coordinates are in the base map's projection's coordinate system. The method is called from the main thread.

Parameters:
vectorElement - vector element on which the normal click was performed on
x - x component of the click coordinate
y - y component of the click coordinate
longClick - true if a long click was performed, false if a normal click was performed

onLabelClicked

public abstract void onLabelClicked(VectorElement vectorElement,
                                    boolean longClick)
Gets called when a click is performed on a vector element's label. The method is called from the main thread.

Parameters:
vectorElement - vector element whose label was clicked
longClick - true if a long click was performed, false if a normal click was performed

showLabelOnVectorElementClick

public boolean showLabelOnVectorElementClick(VectorElement vectorElement,
                                             boolean longClick)
Gets called right before a click event is called for this vector element. The purpose of this event is to determine if the label of the vector element should be shown. This method gets called from the renderer thread and only if the vector element actually has a label.

Parameters:
vectorElement - the vector element whose label's visibility is being determined
longClick - true if a long click was performed, false if a normal click was performed
Returns:
true if label should be shown, false if not

onSurfaceCreated

public void onSurfaceCreated(javax.microedition.khronos.opengles.GL10 gl,
                             javax.microedition.khronos.egl.EGLConfig config)
Gets called on OpenGL surface is created (after initialization, or after surface is lost). This method is called from GL renderer thread, not from main thread.

Parameters:
gl - gl context for the new surface
config - EGL configuration for the surface

onSurfaceChanged

public void onSurfaceChanged(javax.microedition.khronos.opengles.GL10 gl,
                             int width,
                             int height)
Gets called on OpenGL surface change (f.e. orientation change). This method is called from GL renderer thread, not from main thread.

Parameters:
gl - gl context for the surface
width - width of the new surface in pixels
height - height of the new surface in pixels

onDrawFrame

public void onDrawFrame(javax.microedition.khronos.opengles.GL10 gl)
Gets called at the start of the rendering process. This method can be used to perform synchronized updates to objects before drawing. This method is called from GL renderer thread, not from main thread.

Parameters:
gl - gl context

onDrawFrameBefore3D

public void onDrawFrameBefore3D(javax.microedition.khronos.opengles.GL10 gl,
                                float zoomPow2)
Gets called in the middle of the rendering process, after all 2D elements have been drawn (f.e. raster and geometry layers) and right before any 3D elements (f.e 3d polygon, text, marker and 3d model layers). No special OpenGL state clearing is performed beforehand and all the states are expected to remain the same. This method is called from GL renderer thread, not from main thread.

Parameters:
gl - gl context
zoomPow2 - zoom step of the current view

onDrawFrameAfter3D

public void onDrawFrameAfter3D(javax.microedition.khronos.opengles.GL10 gl,
                               float zoomPow2)
Gets called in the end of the rendering process, after all 3D elements have already been drawn (f.e 3d polygon, text, marker and 3d model layers) and right before any overlay elements (f.e vector element labels). No special OpenGL state clearing is performed beforehand and all the states are expected to remain the same. This method is called from GL renderer thread, not from main thread.

Parameters:
gl - gl context
zoomPow2 - zoom step of the current view

onBackgroundTasksStarted

public void onBackgroundTasksStarted()
Gets called when new background tasks are created that will update visible items in the future. As background tasks may take several seconds to execute, this is a good place to show a progress indicator. This method is called from main thread.

onBackgroundTasksFinished

public void onBackgroundTasksFinished()
Gets called when all background tasks have stopped and view is already updated or will be updated very shortly afterwards. This is a good place to hide progress indicator if it was displayed in onBackgroundTasksStarted. This method is called from main thread.
